title: Israelis protest legal overhaul plans for 11th week
description: Israelis took to the streets in protests, now in their 11th week, against plans by Benjamin Netanyahu’s hard-line government to overhaul the country’s legal system

title: Military: rocket fired from Gaza lands on southern Israel
description: Israel says Palestinian militants in the Gaza Strip fired a rocket toward its southern territories

title: US warns about fake, dangerous pills being sold in Mexico
description: The U.S. State Department has issued a travel warning about dangerous counterfeit pills being sold at pharmacies in Mexico that often contain fentanyl

title: Strong earthquake shakes coastal Ecuador; damage unclear
description: There is no immediate word on major damage or injuries after a strong earthquake shook Ecuador

title: Pope promotes 'humanitarian corridors' for migrants
description: Pope Francis is seeking to promote legal migration routes to Europe as an alternative to smuggling operations that he says have turned the Mediterranean into a “cemetery.”

title: Millions of dead fish wash up amid heat wave in Australia
description: Millions of fish have washed up dead in southeastern Australia in what authorities and scientists say is caused by floods and hot weather

title: Novak Djokovic to miss Miami Open, denied covid vaccine exemption
description: Tennis star Novak Djokovic, who is not vaccinated against the coronavirus, had hoped U.S. authorities would grant him an exemption to play at the Miami Open.

title: Journalists held over South Sudan president video are freed
description: South Sudan’s National Security Service has released the remaining journalists who had been detained for weeks over a video apparently showing the country’s president urinating on himself during an event

title: UK minister in Rwanda to reinforce migrant deportation plan
description: Britain’s Home Secretary has arrived in Rwanda for a visit aimed at reinforcing the U.K. government’s commitment to a controversial plan to deport some asylum-seekers to the African country

title: Turkey’s top diplomat visits Cairo in effort to mend ties
description: Turkey’s foreign minister is in Cairo for talks with Egyptian officials as the regional powers seek to mend their frayed ties after years of tensions

title: Notre Dame’s new spire is underway, with hopes of late 2024 reopening
description: The cathedral, normally Paris's most visited landmark, has been closed since it was gutted by an April 2019 fire.

title: Russian attacks continue in wake of Putin arrest warrant
description: Widespread Russian attacks have continued in Ukraine following the International Criminal Court’s decision to issue an arrest warrant for Russian President Vladimir Putin and Russia’s commissioner for children’s rights

title: U.S. veterans won justice for burn pit exposure. Iraqis were forgotten.
description: On American military bases, trash was burned in the open, poisoning the air. In the villages surrounding Iraq's largest burn pit, sickness has been a constant.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Putin’s ICC arrest warrant is justified, Biden says
description: President Biden said his Russian counterpart "clearly committed war crimes," though neither country recognizes the International Criminal Court's jurisdiction.

title: War forces thousands of disabled Ukrainians into institutions
description: Thousands of disabled Ukrainians, many of them elderly, are being institutionalized after being displaced by the war. Social service providers are overwhelmed.

title: Mexican migrant killed in California capsize left daughter
description: Yecenia Lazcano Soriano left behind a 4-year-old daughter in her home town of Tehuacan, Mexico, when she set out almost in secret to reach the United States
